basics.name: Yuechuan Hou
basics.label: Master's Student
basics.summary: A Master's student at Carnegie Mellon University with experience in Robotics and Computer Vision, currently focusing on learning-based human pose 3D reconstruction.

projects.name: Dense 3D Reconstruction of Dynamic Actors in Natural Environments using Multiple Flying Cameras
projects.summary: Research project funded by the National Science Foundation Grant No. 2024173.
highlights: Formation Planning: Designed adaptive aerial formations for filming groups of people based on Python and ROS.
Field Testing: Developed and executed planning and control strategies for filming moving individuals using an aerial robot equipped with GPS-based tracking.
3D Reconstruction: Human pose detection using OpenPose with photo-realistic simulation via Isaac Sim and progressed towards a comprehensive 3D pose reconstruction pipeline.

projects.name: Advanced Cross-Platform Game Porting of 'Metal Slug' with C++ and OpenGL
projects.summary: Team project at Carnegie Mellon University.
highlights: Game Adaptation: Transitioned 'Metal Slug' to modern platforms using C++ and OpenGL, ensuring seamless gameplay functionality.
Game Design: Architected intricate gameplay mechanics and graphics, delivering an immersive user experience through algorithms.
AI Integration: Engineered intelligent enemy behaviors and integrated dynamic difficulty scaling based on player performance to maintain a balanced gameplay experience.

projects.name: Investigation of Thermal Mechanical Properties of 3D Printed Lattice Cooling Structure for Hot Section Components Using High Temperature Alloys
projects.summary: Research project funded by the National Natural Science Foundation of China.
highlights: Deep Learning Modeling: Designed neural network algorithms for accurate heat transfer property predictions of varied lattice structures.
System Optimization: Integrated genetic algorithms to optimize the heat transfer efficiency.
Algorithm Verification: Employed nonlinear regression and sensitivity analysis, ensuring the precision and robustness of algorithms for real-world applicability.
